column4: when i have edited my source file with nano and i press save it says that i can't save it with that name
i tried to use sudo i didn know what it was
so i have to write everything from the start
it says that it dosnt know hat sudo is???
i am using debain not ubuntu
you must install sudo on some distros for it to work. 'sudo' is optional in Slackware as well.
yes. so that apt reloads your sources.list
why don't you just install ubuntu on another partition to try it out?
becaus i have just installed debain bevause i dont have any cd-rom
if you can log in as root, why do you need sudo?
if you can edit sources.list you already are root
